results.title: Physical growth and motor development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Emphasises individual differences by depicting a wide range of normal physical growth and motor development. Discusses ways in which environmental factors such as nutrition and the mother’s health habits during pregnancy affect development. Traces developmental patterns and norms by examining the role of crawling in simultaneously developing both parts of the brain and the sequences of development across cultures and between genders.

results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: 2 1/2 to 6 years”.
This episode explores two major approaches to cognitive development: Piaget’s theory and the examination of the basic cognitive processes involved in problem solving. In understanding how children think, from the concepts of “magical thought” where children implicitly accept that what an adult says will happen, and where the seperation of fact from fantasy is not clear to a child, to the more complex and abstract thought processes used by older children, the development of the child as a confident thinking individual can be traced.

results.title: Psychosocial development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: 2 1/2 to 6 years”.
Describes the social and emotional stages of development of the toddler, up until the end of the pre-school years. These include self-awareness, interacting and socializing with others, developing self-control, learning new roles and skills. Looks at the theories of Erikson for this age level as well as issues of discipline, developing empathy and the child’s natural curiousity about their body.

results.title: Physical growth and motor development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: 2 1/2 to 6 years”.
Between the ages of 2-6, two major developments occur. Children learn to co-ordinate their body movements and to function independently in basic living skills such as eating and dressing. Physiological development displays a greater spectrum of individuality but generally the stomach doubles in size, although appetite is often reduced, the brain grows and the immune system develops. Muscle strength is related to maturation, however at this stage there is minimal difference between genders in motor performance. In this stage of development, children learn to explore concepts such as depth, size, height and develop spatial awareness.

results.title: The Photographic vision
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description: This telecourse presents the technical principles of photography, the mechanics of the camera itself, the chemical and physical reactions which produce a permanent image and the use of various types of equipment and techniques to produce better quality photographs. The course explores the historical tradition in photography and the impact of the medium.

results.title: A Lifetime in photography
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 20 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Max Yavno is a photographer whose career has encompassed more than fifty years. Mr. Yavno’s reflections about his career summarizes many of the skills and ideas presented throughout the series.

results.title: The Marketplace
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Dispels the notion that one cannot make a living in photography with the emphasis on taking a creative approach in order to do so. A range of experts in the field from the director of a gallery, a photojournalist, commercial photographer and mountain climbing photographer, Galen Rowell discuss their careers and approaches.

results.title: Artistic expression
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Overviews the artisitic expression of two innovative photographers, Nathan Lyons and Susan Rankaitis. The curator of the George Eastman House discusses the highly individualistic images produced by these photographers.

results.title: Photojournalism
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photojournalist Ross Baughman describes his techniques for obtaining picture stories. Explores the issues of truth, objectivity and ethics in photojournalism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
